;November 2023, Gansu Jingning County, Pingliang City, the province, is the village where the primary school where the incident occurred. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Gao Yichen

;

;The car stopped at the location where the name of the village was marked on the electronic map, with mountains on one side and cliffs on the other.

;

;The driver carefully turned around, turned in through the overlooked gap, and drove through three turns on the newly found path and around two mountains. The ravine between them reaches the other side of the mountain. This is the destination - a remote village within the jurisdiction of Jingning County, Pingliang City, Gansu Province, where the electronic map failed to include the correct location.

;

;Looking from a distance, this village almost looks like it grows on an earthy hillside, with buildings with red roofs and white walls stacked on top of each other around the mountainside. On November 16, 2023, the village was sparsely populated. The snow has melted, and an elderly couple is working in the fields, planning to hoe the soil to grow potatoes. The apples that the locals are proud of have been picked and sold, and the village is about to enter a slack period.

;

;Nine days ago, a person close to the village was executed. His name is Zhang Longji, born in Jingning County in 1979, with a university education. According to the announcement of the Pingliang Intermediate Court, from 2010 to June 2019, when he served as the teaching director, principal and teacher of a primary school in Jingning County, he used corporal punishment and other means to form a mental coercion on primary school students who lacked sexual defense ability. He used explanation exercises, When students handed in homework and other opportunities, they repeatedly raped 5 young girls aged 8 to 12 years old in their dormitories, and repeatedly raped 17 girls aged 8 to 14 years old in public in the classroom or in their dormitories. Child molestation.

;

;Perhaps to protect the privacy of the victim, the court did not disclose the name of the elementary school where Zhang Longji taught. Southern Weekend reporters learned that the primary school where the incident occurred was the village primary school in the aforementioned village and had been withdrawn and merged in 2019.

;

;When the news that "a primary school principal raped and molested 22 girls in 9 years" caused an uproar on the Internet, this village in the eye of the storm seemed particularly silent.

;

;A small village in the mountains

;

;"Especially in our village, don't ask about these things." Upon hearing Zhang Longji's name, villager Zhang Bi Peng's tone became stern. On November 16, 2023, he stood at the gate of the hospital and waved his hands to the Southern Weekend reporter as if to drive him away. "It's all my sad past."

;

;Zhang Bipeng’s yard is only a few hundred meters away from the original site of the primary school where the incident occurred. Only the couple lives at home, and his father, Zhang Pinghe, takes care of his grandson in Jingning County.

;

;Zhang Pinghe is the old principal of the primary school where the incident occurred. He has taught in the village for more than 40 years and has now retired. On social platforms, he is called "Perseverance in the Mountains."

;

;Today, the empty and abandoned school building remains at the north end of the village. The gate is locked from the outside and cannot be entered. The outside of the courtyard is filled with corn stalks as high as the wall. Compared with the picture that appeared in the news ten years ago, the red roof of the elementary school bungalow still looks the same, and the exterior wall has turned white, as if it had been painted and repaired in the last few years, and the windows and doors are sealed.

;

;The yard next to the school is still open. There are only two old houses. One is piled with props for celebrating the New Year and the lion dance. The other has several An old, dusty wooden table with medals hanging on the wall. Among the dead branches and weeds, there are two green basketball hoops. A villager said that this area is the school playground.

;

;The villager introduced that the primary school was merged in 2019, and then the children in the village went to the central primary school in the town. It was the first boarding school in the town.

;

;Before the merger, this rural primary school was once a model in Jingning County. Among more than a dozen schools in the township, it ranked among the top three in performance every year. There are not many people in the school. When Sun Chuning, a staff member of the Jingning County Education Bureau, visited in 2015, there were only 29 students and 5 teachers in the school. Many students go to towns or counties with their migrant parents.

;

;In 2015, Zhang Pinghe was still the principal, one or two years away from retirement. Sun Chuning had a good impression of the old principal, "Teacher Zhang has been taking care of the school for decades, both during winter and summer vacations." He said he did not know Zhang Longji and did not pay attention to his situation when he visited the school.

;

;The old principal has been commended repeatedly. According to public reports, he once took teachers to quarry clay to paint classrooms, went to a forest farm to collect waste materials to make simple tables and stools, and stayed at the school building to dig canals to divert water during heavy rains. Some netizens said in the comment area that in their memory, even the wife of the old principal pulled a trolley and worked in the school.

;

;A Pingliang photographer once shot a short film for the old principal when he was about to retire. He said that the photo was taken for "awards and competitions". At the end of the film, the words "Produced by Jingning County Education Bureau" appear.

;

;At the same time, Zhou Lan, a school-age student who lived in a nearby village, came to this primary school to study. The school's reputation is one of the reasons why parents choose the school, but more importantly, it is almost his "only solution" for transportation.

;

;The surrounding area is inconvenient and there is no public transportation. Students measure distance by round-trip walking time, and anything that can be reached by walking in 30 minutes is considered "very close." The map shows that Zhou Lan has to walk about 7 kilometers to the central primary school in the town, which takes an hour and a half on foot. At that time, "there was an age requirement for living in school there, and you had to be in fifth grade or fourth grade." So Zhou Lan could only attend this village primary school.

;

;The grandchildren of the old principal did not study in this village primary school, but were sent to the county town and are now studying in high school. Zhang Bipeng explained that it was because “the conditions in the county are good.”

;

;The number of teachers and students in rural primary schools is constantly decreasing. At its peak, the school had more than 200 students. A few years before Zhou Lan enrolled, there were more than 100 people in the school. “There were quite a lot of people at that time, but they all left in the end.” In a school evaluation and acceptance self-inspection report filled out by Zhang Pinghe in 2016, the school had only 21 students and 4 faculty members, divided into 4 teaching classes.

;

;The report states that the primary school was founded in 1957. It was expanded into a standardized primary school on the original site in 2002 and changed to a six-year complete primary school in 2003. The old principal wrote this paragraph in the report: The school carefully organizes teachers and students to study education laws and regulations, teachers' law, and the Law on the Protection of the Rights and Interests of Minors. All teachers and students in the school know, understand and abide by the law.

;

;Zhang Longji is one of the above-mentioned teachers. A relevant roster of Jingning County in 2014 shows that Zhang Longji was a professional technical level 12 and a primary school teacher level 2 at that time.

;

;In 2017, Zhang Longji took over as the principal of this village primary school. The transfer of teachers in rural schools is the responsibility of the local education bureau. The principal of a rural primary school in Gansu said that the position of principal must go through layers of selection before being qualified, including examinations and background training. “Each unit has to go through it again. For example, if there is a problem with your credit card, you will not be allowed to pass. , particularly strict."

;

;According to the court notice, Zhang Longji had been committing crimes for several years at this time. Why didn’t Zhang Longji’s actions attract attention during this period? As of press time, Zhang Pinghe had not responded to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Jingning County Education Bureau stated that the relevant details involve the protection of minors, so it is inconvenient to disclose them.

;

;“I didn’t understand it at that time, so I saw it as a joke”

;

;When Zhou Lan was studying in this village primary school, he saw Zhang Longji with his own eyes He molested students in the classroom, but felt he had no choice but to do anything about it because "he is the principal."

;

;After the school was annexed and the school building was locked, Zhou Lan and several male classmates secretly climbed over the wall and entered. He said that Zhang Longji had two dormitories at the school, one of which belonged to his wife. The couple has two girls and one boy, and their three children sometimes come to live in the dormitory.

;

;Zhou Lan said that he and his classmates tore off the seal on the dormitory door and held a "special ceremony" inside. According to the video sent by Zhou Lan, they placed a photo on a low table, placed three small trays in front of the photo, placed chocolate pie on it, and burned paper on the side. Before Zhang Longji's execution, this "ceremony" with the meaning of memorial was a kind of revenge. They have been held three times in total, the last time in October 2023.

;

;Zhou Lan hated this teacher in her heart. He said that Zhang Longji often corporally punished and beat students, and he was very cruel. "He took a stick and hit me on the head, (beating) to death, which cast a shadow on me."

;

;They are the last batch of students Zhang Longji taught and are now in junior high school. Zhou Lan recalled that before the incident in 2019, there were only three girls left in the school, and some had transferred away before. Zhang Longji would molest girls in front of him. When correcting homework in class, he would also call girls to the podium and molest them in public.

;

;He also heard from girls in the school that Zhang Longji would call them to the dormitory. When school was over in the evening, Zhang Longji would use excuses such as "the homework was not finished" to prevent female students from going home and keep them until after nine o'clock in the evening. He said that he was still young at the time and had little idea of ​​what Zhang Longji did. He only thought it was strange and did not tell his parents.

;

;What Zhou Lan saw was just the tip of the iceberg. During an interview with Southern Weekend reporters, we learned that the incident of being molested by Zhang Longji was probably earlier than the time mentioned in the court notice and had occurred since his early years of teaching.

;

;From 2004 to 2005, Lulu was in the first grade of a primary school in the town, and Zhang Longji, who was about 25 years old at the time, was her math teacher. She recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that at that time the school was a bungalow and it was very cold in winter, so they used stoves to burn charcoal for heating. During math class, Zhang Longji would call a female student to the podium, hold her in his arms, and "do some very intimate gestures" in front of thirty or forty students in the class, in the name of checking her homework. She said that she had personally seen several girls in the class being hugged, and "he would pick some of the prettier little girls."

;

;Lulu herself is also a victim. Zhang Longji held her in his arms and breathed into her, "I felt very strange, so I hid."

;

;By 2009, Professor Zhang Longji’s subject changed from mathematics to English. That year, Zhang Lei, a male student, was in the third grade. During class, Zhang Longji held the girl in his arms and taught her vocabulary, touched her face, and behaved affectionately. He saw a female classmate sitting on Zhang Longji's lap with a look of disgust on her face. Forced by the teacher's authority, she did not dare to make any big moves to resist. She could only twist her body to avoid his physical contact, but it did not have much effect. “I didn’t understand it at that time, so I just took it as a joke.”

;

;In the same year, during a break in class, fifth-grade Lin Ling said that she was lying on her back in class. When she was sleeping on the table, there were many students in the classroom, and Zhang Longji suddenly hugged her from behind. Lin Ling was frightened and quickly said, "Hurry up and let me go." He let go.

;

;According to the accounts of former students, Zhang Longji’s obscene behavior lasted for a long time, and students of different grades were victimized. "He should have been molesting girls since he first joined the workforce... My last class, my current class, my next class, including my sister's class all know about it." November 2023 , Lin Ling told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Lin Ling said that female students did not dare to get along with Zhang Longji and were afraid of being hugged by him. They felt "especially annoying" and privately complained to each other "Why is he That’s it again”. "But we didn't even realize at the time that he was breaking the law."

;

;Ignored help

;

;The first female students Zhang Longji molested Have tried to save myself. Lulu, who was 7 years old at the time, told her mother about this "strange thing". Her mother didn't take it seriously and just thought it was an elder's love for children. "She said that your math teacher thinks you are very good and feels sorry for you."

;

;During the parent-teacher conference, Zhang Longji would face Lulu’s mother Praise her and say that the little girl is "very smart and well-behaved". Lulu analyzed that this strengthened her mother's judgment and made her feel that the young mathematics teacher was very responsible and appreciated her daughter, without any warning. Looking back, Lulu feels that rural parents “are very lacking in awareness in this regard.”

;

;Lin Ling agreed with this analysis. She euphemistically said that the adults in the village are relatively simple, traditional and conservative. Lin Ling, who was 12 years old at the time, told her mother that there was a teacher in school who always hugged female classmates during class and also hugged herself, but the answer she received was unexpected. "My mother said that my thoughts were not sincere."

;

;Talking about the memory of asking her parents for help in fifth grade to no avail, the adult Lin Ling hesitated for a few seconds. ,Sighed. "Maybe he has a better personality, but the adults don't believe it." She told her mother two or three times, but when she saw her mother's reaction, she stopped mentioning it.

;

;In front of children and adults, Zhang Longji has two different faces. When facing students, he sometimes kissed and hugged them, and sometimes violently punished them. But when facing adults, in Lulu's words, he behaved politely and responsibly, "it's quite invisible." His WeChat avatar is an ID photo with a red background, a Chinese character face, single eyelids, a wide nose, a smile, wearing a black suit and a red polka dot tie, and his hair is meticulously combed.

;

;Where Zhang Longji grew up, the villagers also had a good impression of him. Compared with the remote teaching villages, Xiaohe Village in Gangou Town, where Zhang Longji's home is located, is closer to Jingning County and has convenient transportation. In the eyes of the villagers, Zhang Longji is one of the few "top students" who has gone to university, with high academic qualifications and decent work.
;

;

;A villager said that Zhang Longji and his two sisters were both college students. After graduation, they earned money and renovated old houses in the village. A building was bought in the county seat. Zhang Longji's wife is a teacher. "His wife is teaching. She is slim (dialect means thin) and her family is in good condition."

;

;Now the Zhang family's house is vacant, the iron door is rusty and locked, unused bricks are piled in the inner courtyard, and the red paper on the porch has faded. The courtyard is scattered with yellow leaves floating off the branches. The above-mentioned villagers said with some sadness that Zhang Longji's family was poor when he was a child. The shoes his mother wore were made of rags without uppers. His father sold rapeseed and raised three college students with hard work. They never thought that he would go down the wrong path.

;

;;< /p>;

;The old house of Zhang Longji’s family in Xiaohe Village, Jingning County, Pingliang City, Gansu Province. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Gao Yichen

;

;The last time the villagers saw Zhang Longji was in 2019. Some villagers remember that in April of that year, an old man died in the village, and Zhang Longji returned to the village to "carry and bury the person." He was in "good condition" at the time, but he did not expect that the crime of rape and molestation was about to be exposed.

;

;More than a month later, Zhang Longji was taken away by the police during the Dragon Boat Festival after a victim's family called the police.

;

;Zhang Longji still has relatives who run a supermarket in Xiaohe Village. He said that Zhang Longji rarely returned to the village after settling in the county, and there was not much contact between the two parties. "After the old man (Zhang Longji's parents) disappeared, he would not come back for a year or two. When he came back, he would have a quick meeting and we would not chat."

;

;He refused to recall when he learned that Zhang Longji molested students. "These things have happened, and now everyone here knows that there is such a person. There are some things that we can't talk about in depth, can't say, and don't want to say."

;

; A 64-year-old villager still has a good impression of Zhang Longji, thinking that he is a decent person and behaves "stablely."

;

;He may have never seen Zhang Longji's ruthless side. According to the students' accounts, both boys and girls were beaten by Zhang Longji, and iron rods, steel bars, and mops were all "weapons." A boy recalled that when he was 9 years old and in third grade, he was beaten so hard that he "couldn't sit still for a month, and his buttocks were all black."

;

;Violence makes seeking help more difficult. Lin Ling remembers that when he was in first grade, Zhang Longji kicked a boy from the front of the podium to the back of the classroom. "No one dared to resist, really. Because he beat people so fiercely, we didn't dare to say anything."

;

;"I never mentioned the past injuries again"

; < p style="text-align: left;">;The most difficult time for Lin Ling to let go was watching her friend being hurt by Zhang Longji. One day when she was in the fourth or fifth grade, during extracurricular activities, she and her friends went to Zhang Longji's dormitory to hand in homework. Zhang just came back from playing ball and was naked in the dormitory, wearing only shorts. "When we handed in our homework, he hugged my classmate and kissed him hard there. It scared me. I ran away quickly."

;

;There were no other teachers around at that time. Lin Ling ran out and told another classmate what happened. The two comforted each other and said, "It should be fine." About 10 minutes later, the classmate who was hugged came out of Zhang Longji's dormitory. Lin Ling asked about her situation, and the reply she received was "nothing."

;

;"I was very worried about that classmate of mine, but when we were young, we didn't dare to say anything." Lin Ling recalled.

;

;That memory became the shadow of her childhood. She always remembered that the female classmate who was being hugged was trying to resist and try to break free, but she was only a primary school student, thin and not very strong. Zhang Longji kept holding her and kissed her on the mouth. It was only after Lin Ling grew up that she realized, "Every time we hand in homework or do anything else, we have to go to his separate dormitory."

;

;Things are buried deep in the hearts of the two girls. "I know (that incident did) a lot of harm to my classmate, but until now I haven't dared to ask her. She is now married, and the matter has never been mentioned again."

;

;For twenty years, most of the victims licked their wounds silently. After the news that "a primary school principal raped and molested 22 girls in 9 years" attracted attention, some people worried on social platforms: What will happen to the children who have been harmed? They still have a long way to go.

;

;Sun Xuemei, the initiator of "Girls Protection" and deputy editor-in-chief of ifeng.com, told Southern Weekend reporters that after being sexually assaulted, children's psychology will change, even in the long term. Troubled, I hope that with the help of the local Women's Federation and other departments, the children can receive timely psychological intervention.

;

;She specifically reminded parents not to beat, scold or blame their children. "This is not the child's fault. We need to make the child feel that the family is safe and that parents can accept talking and relying on them. If after such an incident, parents beat, scold and blame them, they will push the child into a more helpless situation. ."

;

;The "Girls Protection" project team has been to many rural schools across the country to conduct sexual assault prevention courses. Sun Xuemei found that the common problem currently is the lack of sex education, and many people talk about sexual perversion. However, it can be seen from the gradually increasing reporting rate that people's awareness is improving. "Only when everyone's awareness increases and they pay attention to this problem, and (the problem) is exposed more and more, will it be solved faster."

;

;The end of Zhang Longji’s criminal behavior was due to the call to the police by the victim’s family in June 2019.

;

;Zhou Lan recalled that at noon on the day of the incident, Zhang Longji drove away from school. Also disappearing was a female classmate from the school. "After class, (I) saw that the girl was not there, so I told other teachers. I didn't know that until the next day."

;

;He heard from the girl’s sister that the girl tried her best to resist and was beaten with a heavy object by Zhang Longji and was seriously injured. The girl was sent to Jingning County Hospital, but her injuries were serious and she was sent to Lanzhou for medical treatment. Zhang Longji was later taken away by the police in Lanzhou.

;

;In November 2019, 30-year-old Yu Tong met Zhang Longji in the detention center, and the two stayed in the same cell for three months. After completing his sentence in 2023, he provided his release certificate to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In the prison cell, Zhang Longji wore a red vest, handcuffs and shackles. Yu Tong said that "inmates" all knew that he was suspected of rape and child molestation. During that period, Zhang Longji was often bullied by his fellow prisoners and had to be moved from one cell to another. Another "inmate" Zhao Wuping also confirmed that "people like him are often bullied in there."

;

;Zhao Wuping entered the detention center for drunk driving in July 2019. He was "headache" about his situation and did not want to chat with other people. But he remembered that Zhang Longji's condition at the time was "not bad" and he said, "He will be released after being sentenced to more than ten years."

;

;The seriousness of the matter obviously exceeded Zhang Longji's expectations.

;

;Pingliang Intermediate Court sentenced Zhang Longji to death for rape and deprivation of political rights for life; for child molestation, he was sentenced to ten years in prison; several crimes were punished concurrently. ,Decided to implement the death penalty, deprivation of political rights for life. Zhang Longji once appealed, but the appeal was rejected by the Gansu Provincial High Court and the original death sentence was upheld, which was approved by the Supreme People's Court.

;

;On November 7, 2023, the Pingliang Intermediate People’s Court followed the execution order issued by the President of the Supreme People’s Court, verified Zhang Longji’s identity, and escorted him to the execution ground. Execution by lethal injection.

;

;Recently, some parents posted online that on November 23, 2023, Changtu County, Tieling City, Liaoning Province The Experimental Primary School transferred a student from Class 11, Grade 4, to Class 8 without communicating with the parent committee. The article stated that the student threatened the entire class when handing out mid-term exam papers, hugged the teacher's lap and cried and made a fuss. He also knelt down and prayed to the teacher not to tell his parents about the test results. After being rejected, he threatened and insulted the teacher, causing the head teacher to be hospitalized due to sudden illness. .

;

;Parents protested collectively and picked up their children early to start a class strike. On November 29, the local education bureau issued a notice stating that the primary school was transferring a student to a parallel class. Parents of the students who were transferred to the class showed resistance, and many students did not attend school. They reported the matter online. Changtu County Education Bureau and Experimental Primary School... decided after research to cancel the class adjustment plan.

;

;What do you think of this incident? First, it is necessary to explore the nature of the student's problem. If what the above parents said is true, then from the fact that the student threatens the whole class, begs the teacher, and threatens and insults the teacher, it seems that the student may have behavioral problems, but the specific problem is still difficult to determine.

;

;However, it is not difficult to understand the position of the parents of Class 8: originally the class order and discipline were good, but suddenly a "troublemaker" and "trouble maker" came, making other children uneasy and affecting their learning. No one will welcome it, cause tensions, or even upset children's moods. If you can't turn them away before you come, it will be difficult to ask them to leave after they come.

;

;Because a student in a class has behavioral problems or character problems, disrupts classroom order or bullies other students; or parents are overprotective of their children and have serious conflicts with other children and their parents. , As a result, other parents can't bear it anymore, and they "go on strike" in anger, go to the Education Bureau to petition, and complain online. This often happens.

;

;In 2019, parents of fifth graders at Hangzhou Wenlan Experimental School published an open letter online saying that a student named W was an overprotected child by his parents. If he had any disputes with teachers or classmates at school, his parents would directly They stormed schools and classrooms, and repeatedly threatened and abused the children, parents, and even teachers in extreme ways. For this reason, parents went on strike in anger. A situation report issued by the school stated that "an incident occurred in Class 505 of our school where many students asked for leave but did not come to school to study."

;

;Secondly, the way the school and the local education bureau handle such incidents is nothing more than trying their best to mediate and persuade.

;

;Changtu County Experimental Primary School gave up its plan to adjust classes, saying it "will further optimize educational resources, rationally allocate teachers, and teach students in accordance with their aptitude." The implication is that the students with the problem will continue to remain in Class 11, but it seems that they will be replaced by teachers who are more resistant and more capable to tackle the problem. "Currently, students have fully returned to school," and the problem has been temporarily resolved.

;

;In the case of the strike at Hangzhou Wenlan Experimental School, a joint special class composed of the District Education Bureau and the District Public Security Bureau was established, and then a parent interview meeting was held to "carefully listen to the parents' feedback and demands." “Both parties actively communicated to eliminate differences, and after discussions, a preliminary consensus was reached.” Students who asked for leave “returned to school one after another” that afternoon.

;

;Why are similar solutions so common? This is because the current Compulsory Education Law stipulates that students who violate the school management system shall be criticized and educated by the school and shall not be expelled (Article 27). Under such constraints, if there are "problem children" in a class who are considered unbearable by many parents, they can only tolerate it at the beginning. If they can't bear it anymore, they will use strikes, petitions, and open letters online to try to overcome the pressure of public opinion. Let the "problem children" transfer to another school; if they really can't be driven away, well-connected parents will consider transferring their children to another school.

;

;Of course, there are many people on the Internet who say, and their voices are quite loud: Isn’t it enough to transfer “problem children” to vocational schools for correction? This simplifies the problem.

;

;Indeed, Article 6 of the Law on the Prevention of Juvenile Delinquency stipulates: The state shall strengthen the construction of specialized schools and provide specialized education to minors with serious bad behaviors. So, what constitutes serious bad behavior?

;

;The bad behavior defined in this law refers to "behavior carried out by minors that is not conducive to their healthy growth", such as truancy and truancy for many times; associating with people with bad habits in society, organizing or Joining a gang that commits bad behavior, etc. Obviously, it is fine if bad behavior only harms oneself. The key is that many bad behaviors have negative externalities and will harm other children.

;

;Article 31 of the Law stipulates: Schools shall strengthen management and education for underage students who have bad behaviors and shall not discriminate; for those who refuse to correct or the circumstances are serious, the school may punish them according to the circumstances or take the following measures: Management education measures: provide discipline; require compliance with specific codes of conduct; require participation in specific special education; require participation in on-campus service activities; require psychological counseling and behavioral intervention from social workers or other professionals, etc. But obviously not including expulsion.

;

;The so-called serious bad behavior refers to "behavior committed by minors that is stipulated in the criminal law and not subject to criminal punishment because they are under the legal age of criminal responsibility, as well as behavior that seriously endangers society", such as fighting in groups, chasing , intercepting others, forcibly taking or arbitrarily damaging or occupying public or private property and other provocative and troublemaking behaviors; beating, insulting, threatening, or intentionally injuring others' bodies, etc. So can someone with this kind of behavior be immediately sent to a vocational school? Neither.

;

;Article 41 of the Law stipulates: For minors who have serious bad behavior, the public security organs may take the following corrective and educational measures according to the specific circumstances: admonish them; order them to apologize and compensate for losses; order them to declare repentance. ; Ordered to regularly report on activities; ordered to abide by specific behavioral norms and not to perform specific behaviors, contact specific people, or enter specific places; ordered to receive psychological counseling and behavioral modification; ordered to participate in social service activities, etc.

;

;If a minor commits an act that seriously endangers society, the circumstances are egregious or causes serious consequences, or if a minor commits an act that seriously endangers society multiple times, or refuses to accept or cooperate with the corrective education measures stipulated in Article 41 above, Upon evaluation and approval by the Specialized Education Steering Committee, the education administrative department together with the public security organs may decide to send the student to a specialized school to receive specialized education.

;Recently, there is news that Hebei “billionaire” Xie Kefeng has recovered his son Xie Qingshuai who has been trafficked for 25 years. It was widely circulated on the Internet and attracted great attention. Netizens were happy that the Xie family was finally reunited. And behind this, it is inseparable from the blessing of technological power.

;

;According to media reports, the "cross-age face comparison algorithm of relatives" developed by a technology company was indispensable for the family reunion. Xie Qingshuai was only 3 months old when he was abducted, and his family only has photos of him when he was 3 months old. More than twenty years later, it is obviously an "impossible task" to use this baby photo to find someone.

;

;What makes the impossible possible is to use related faces to compare and find suspected objects. Taking the search for Xie Qingshuai as an example, photos of his biological parents and eldest brother were used to compare with the police's population database. This comparison is of course relatively vague and may result in multiple results, but it also greatly narrows the scope of the search, making it easier for the police to conduct precise comparisons through DNA testing and other technologies. In this comparison, Qing Shuai was found among the top five suspects.

;

;The “black technology” used to find abducted children, the most familiar to the public is DNA comparison technology. This technology was first used by the police to identify criminal suspects in major criminal cases. As the cost of testing and comparison decreases, the application of DNA technology is becoming more and more widespread, and it also plays a role in the final "final decision" to determine kinship in the fight against trafficking and finding relatives.

;

;However, DNA comparison also has great limitations, that is, samples from both parties are required for comparison. Parents searching for relatives will naturally take the initiative to submit their own blood samples to the police, but it is not that easy to obtain samples from abducted children. DNA information is one of the most sensitive biological information of an individual. Without sufficient evidence to suspect, the police cannot force anyone to submit their DNA sample at will.

;

;Many of the children’s data in the police anti-trafficking DNA database were submitted to the police by people who knew they had been trafficked, hoping to find their biological parents. Other data comes from trafficked persons rescued by the police during anti-trafficking operations. For those trafficked persons who do not know they are being trafficked and have not been noticed by the police, their DNA information will not appear in the anti-trafficking database and will not be found.

;

;Currently, the police have set up more than 3,000 free blood collection points across the country and publicized them widely, hoping that more people would volunteer to provide blood samples and increase the coverage of the anti-trafficking database. But the number of people who can be included in the DNA database is always limited. In the past, a common method used by families searching for relatives was “human flesh” search. They follow any possible clues and travel all over the country to find relatives all year round, spending time, energy and money. However, the results are very unsatisfactory and very few can actually find the abducted children.

;

;The application of high-tech means such as face comparison and recognition has greatly improved the efficiency of finding relatives. As early as 2019, the police began to use the cross-age facial recognition technology developed by Tencent, and successfully found a child who had been abducted for 10 years using a photo of the abducted child when he was 3 years old. But the technology at the time was not precise enough. According to his father, at that time, 100 suspected persons were found for each identification. The police usually selected the top 5 for DNA review, and the probability of missing a hit was very high.

;

;With the advancement of computer vision and artificial intelligence technology, the accuracy of comparison is getting higher and higher. You can even compare using only photos of close relatives without having to take photos of the child himself. Because everyone has their ID card photo stored in the police database, using photos for identification greatly increases the scope of anti-trafficking comparisons, making it easier to find abducted children. The "cross-age relative face comparison algorithm" helped the police recover four abducted children in just six months, at least three of whom had been abducted for more than 20 years, which shows its ability.

;

;Advanced technology is used to fight abduction and find relatives, which is a good cause. Of course, it must be admitted that if used for evil, its destructive power will be huge. For example, a DNA paternity test may be used to forge paternity test certificates and settle the abducted children at the police station as their "biological" children. Of course, this is fraud, and it may also be said that it has little to do with technology. However, ubiquitous facial recognition is suspected of being abused in large quantities and may infringe on the privacy rights of ordinary people. Technologies such as AI face-changing may also be used in crimes.

;

;There used to be a saying on the Internet that "where there are photos, there is the truth." But with the development of PS technology, photos can no longer represent the truth. Some people use face-swapping techniques to replace the avatars in pornographic photos and use them for blackmail. And with the advancement of video face-changing technology, it is no longer true that "there is a video and there is the truth". The current AI technology can allow Trump to speak authentic Chinese, with flawless timbre and mouth shape, and it is no problem to fake other videos.

;

;Technology itself is neutral. Every black technology is a double-edged sword that can be used for good or for evil. Not only can technology itself be used for evil, but advanced technology can also be used to do evil. As soon as the high-tech cross-age face matching technology for finding relatives attracted attention, rumors of a "paid version of the relative finding app" appeared on the Internet. Families looking for relatives who are eager to find their own flesh and blood are easily deceived and defrauded of their money.

;

;Advanced technology contains huge power. How to use it, for good or evil, all depends on the thoughts of those who master the technology. Only by keeping technology in the hands of "good people" as much as possible, and with good systems for incentives and prevention, can technology be used to its fullest potential.

;

;However, as costs continue to fall, these new technologies will inevitably be available to more and more people, and the possibility of abuse and misuse will become greater and greater. How to prevent advanced technology from being used for evil as much as possible is also a serious issue that must be discussed. The "Gongdou Drama" of OpenAI, which developed ChatGPT some time ago, is related to the attitude towards AI technology to a certain extent. It can be seen that this is no longer a topic of unfounded worry, but an urgent one.

;I was sitting on a small round stool in the outdoor corridor. The stool was short, not very stable, and had no backrest. My feet, which had taken off my shoes, were stepping on a stained floor. I couldn’t walk around on the small carpet because I had to be ready to try on shoes at any time. Fortunately, it was October and I actually felt a cool breeze. Compared to four months ago (mid-June) when I came to order shoes, I was so sweaty that it was so comfortable. too much.

;

;Just sit down and sit down! It has been more than an hour, but it is still better than the shoemaker. It is hard enough to watch him open the soles of the shoes and close the uppers, nailing and hammering. So, although the custom-made shoes have nothing to do with the shape of my feet. They match each other, but they are a bit polar opposite, and they are incompatible with each other. Once the feet are put in, it is as painful as "cutting off the feet to fit the shoes", but when I heard him repeatedly saying, "It's okay, what's wrong with you? I'll do it for you, I'll do it for you." Done." I saw the enthusiasm and confidence on his face, while he was wandering around the studio filled with debris, looking for insoles and playing with shoe lasts. His movements were slow. He was not in a hurry. I How can you be anxious?

;

;Because I was bored sitting around, I could only look around. This is the upper floor of a factory building. There is a long row of rooms, one after another, facing a long gray corridor outside the door. , there was no one on the promenade, only the shoe store was open. If custom-made shoes hadn't come to my door, I believe I would never have come to this quiet area in the New Territories. It takes a taxi from where I live, and it costs hundreds of dollars for a round trip. However, because of a pair of feet with many problems, including hallux valgus, flat feet and fasciitis, I have been unable to find comfortable shoes for many years. , I can only hope that I will become Cinderella. One day, a pair of shoes made in heaven will suddenly appear. Once you put on a pair of shoes, you can walk or dance gracefully. If this is the case, then you will not care about anything. I immediately worked hard to pursue it without any expense.

;

;In order to relieve my worries, my elder brother in Toronto found information from the Internet. He said that there is a mysterious man in Hong Kong who specializes in custom-making shoes for people with special feet. All can be easily solved. This strange man is already very young and is about to retire, so he has to order his shoes quickly, otherwise he will regret it if he misses the opportunity.

;

;For many years, if you want to buy shoes, you have to go to Japan to look for them. Maybe it’s because Japanese people often wear kimonos with flip-flops, so many people’s feet are not in the right shape; or maybe it’s because Japan’s national character is particularly careful. Thoughtful, anyway, if I want to find a decent pair of shoes that can fit on my feet, for me, Japan is the only place of origin. Due to the seriousness of the epidemic, I have not been able to go out for three or four years. My old shoes have been reimbursed and new shoes have not yet been obtained. When I heard that there is such a shoe-making wizard in Hong Kong, wouldn’t it make me excited and have to look for it?

;

;The first time I came to make shoes was in mid-June. Finally, we found the reclusive master based on online information, and they actually connected via WhatsApp in a very modern way, and made an appointment to visit him on a Saturday morning. I called a taxi, drove around, walked a long way, arrived on time excitedly, walked into a completely unfamiliar factory building, stepped into a dirty and dilapidated elevator, rushed up to the high-rise building with great difficulty, and finally found the corresponding location. House number, why is the door locked and dark? I quickly called and contacted, and after a while, the other party finally answered, "I'm in the hospital! I injured my hand, and I'm queuing up to see a doctor!" Ah! Is this okay? Injured your hand while making shoes? Isn't this similar to a piano master suffering from tenosynovitis? This matter is no small matter! "Ah! Take care of yourself! Your hands are the most important. When you are well, we will make an appointment again!" On the phone, I was busy trying to comfort the person. Not only did I not blame the other person for breaking the appointment, I seemed to be full of apologies.

;

;After a while, we met again. When Liu Bei paid three visits to the thatched cottage, he invited Zhuge Kongming, a great genius, to help. In this world, good things are hard to come by. How can it be so easy to achieve a wish? So, with all the fuss, we embarked on the journey for the second time. This time, I finally saw the master himself. To be honest, some traditional local handicrafts are gradually declining, such as hand-made umbrellas, hand-carved sparrows, hand-painted ceramics, hand-made bird cages, etc. The old craftsmen who make cheongsams and are skilled in embroidery or paper-making are also gradually declining. Therefore, seeing a craftsman who has been working hard for decades and sticking to his traditional position makes me feel particularly kind and respectful. The master is thin and frail, with a sincere smile on his face. He talks incessantly, just like a familiar neighbor. He tells you all kinds of stories as soon as he opens his mouth, and how big and small the feet of so and so are. Oops, but once you put on his shoes, the problem is solved; so and so went to Europe to immigrate, and they have to rush back to find him to make shoes, etc. After talking for a long time, I finally remembered that I wanted to do business, so I pulled out a piece of A4 white paper with a snap, asked the visitor to take off his shoes and socks, put his feet on the white paper, and asked him to draw a paper pattern with a pen, and then Write the customer's name and phone number next to it, and the registration procedure is completed. At that time, I thought to myself, why is it so simple? I have been to many shoe-making shops, and I have to constantly use computers and instruments to measure the shape of my feet, and even make models before I can customize them. The finished products made with high technology are often not ideal! Is this old master’s home-made steel-making method feasible? However, once I saw his confident look and his sincere words, I had no choice but to suppress the doubts in my heart, "It's okay to try! Maybe a miracle will happen?"

;

;"Pay a deposit of five hundred first. , the shoes are ready, pay another thousand yuan!" Do you have a receipt? He said no, so he hurriedly offered them all, thinking that for the old-school craftsmen, everything depends on trust, not written evidence. He added, "Everything is clear and well-founded. You don't have to worry." When will the shoes be ready? "I only have one pair of hands. I have to do it every day, and I have to take turns! At least for a month or two. Don't rush me." "Okay, don't rush me if you don't." It seems that he does not have an assistant or an apprentice. You have to be considerate of other people’s hard work!

;

;I brought two pairs of Japanese shoes with me that day. They were trophies that I had purchased during my previous trip to Japan. Because the toe caps were too narrow, I had not worn them. I hope the master can help me with them this time. Making the toe of your shoes wider will be a great benefit. "No problem, it's very easy!" He agreed immediately.

;

;Just like that, from June to October, I asked twice, and each time I was told that I was still in line. Finally, at the end of October, the shoes were actually ready! So I went there on a certain day, ready to receive the finished product.

;

;I had no illusions and no hope, so when I put on my new shoes that day, a sharp pain hit me. I was not disappointed or resentful. This was to be expected! Of course, the master was not disappointed. He said confidently: "It's like this. It's a little tight when I put it on. I'll do it for you. It'll be done soon." So he started to get busy. And me? I sat leisurely on the corridor, looking at the scenery on the hillside not far away, and started to enjoy it. I saw the windows of public houses hung with colorful clothes, commonly known as the Ten Thousand Flags. The green trees on the hillside were shaded, and the white clouds were floating in the blue sky. Suddenly, a group of white pigeons passed by in front of my eyes, and there was peace. It turns out that when waiting, choose to be optimistic. Being angry or calm only exists in a thought.

;

;At this time, I remembered that there were still two pairs of Japanese shoes to be retrieved, and asked the master to get the shoes. He said: "Ah! My memory is not good, I can't remember where I put them! What are the shoes?" How does it look like?" He asked, smiling innocently, with an innocent look on his face, which suddenly reminded me of the launch of the "Brain Care" program of CUHK by Kao Kun, which had to deal with the problem of memory degradation in the elderly. Have sympathy! Then, he said, why not let your Filipino maid go into the studio and look for it yourself? That place is really weird. It's more like a landfill than a studio. It's filled with all kinds of materials and tools, leaving only a narrow path that can be walked sideways. To find the target in it, it should be better than a lost city. Treasure hunting is even harder! The Filipino maid tried her best to go around in a circle but came back in vain. When she got to the door, she looked at me and the two of them couldn't help laughing!

;

;Here, the master took the trouble to adjust it again and again, and the shoes became looser every time. Every few minutes, I had to test it, standing up and sitting down. So on, after more than a dozen rounds, although the shoes and the foot shape have never reconciled, I think it is time to call it a day and call it a day. "The leather of these shoes is very soft. If you wear them for a few more days, it won't hurt anymore." In your life, when buying and making shoes, have you never heard this kind of advice? I smiled, nodded quickly, paid the balance in a hurry, and prepared to go home. Suddenly, the master announced to me: "If you find your Japanese shoes, I will send them to you by SF Express. You don't have to pay the ten yuan fee, I will pay it!" He said it with great style, Very generous!

;

;On the way back, I calculated in my mind that those two pairs of Japanese shoes cost me several thousand. Three visits to the thatched cottage, the fare plus the shoes cost another several thousand. If I add in the worries, wouldn’t it be Not even worth it? It is better to be happy and relieved. If one day I find the shoes, I will treat them as foreigners and be overjoyed. If they really come to nothing, then won’t that be another grand reason to visit Japan?

;On November 6, 2023, Chi Susheng, the defense lawyer in this case, caused a conflict because his mobile phone was detained. After discovering that he was unwell, the court called an ambulance. (Photo provided by interviewee)

;

; 

;

;This is an "atypical" incident In the gang-related case, the prosecutor accused a gang of 10 people, which had just reached the minimum number of participants in a gang, and there was only one injury appraisal report in the whole case.

;

;The first defendant Liu Shunping is from Xuanwei City (Qujing City), Yunnan Province. The case has gone through three stages: first instance, second instance, and retrial.

;

;The first instance of the original trial determined that the case did not constitute a crime of a gangland nature, and the second instance court remanded the case for a retrial on the grounds that some facts were unclear. However, the public prosecution still insisted on charging the suspect with gang-related crimes, and added new charges and criminal facts.

;

;On October 9, 2023, the Xuanwei City Court opened a new trial, which has lasted for a month and a half and has not yet ended. During this period, the court hearings attracted public attention several times.

;

;The incident with the widest impact is the seizure of lawyers’ cell phones. On November 6, 2023, Chi Susheng, the defender of the third defendant Li Zhengyan in the case, was ordered to withhold his mobile phone by the presiding judge, which caused a conflict in the court. This unexpected incident ended with Chi Susheng being sent to the hospital for emergency treatment and Xuanwei City Court. The dean apologized to Chi Susheng and returned the mobile phone. After that, Chi Susheng went out to recuperate and did not participate in the subsequent defense.

;

;Three cases merged

;

;Liu Shunping's involvement in gangs originated from the arrest of Zhang Jian, the gang leader in Xuanwei City.

;

;On January 13, 2019, the Xuanwei City Public Security Bureau controlled a large number of members of the gang headed by Zhang Jian while promoting the special campaign against gangs and evil. Later, Zhang Jian was sentenced to suspended death. There were more than 90 defendants in the "Zhang Jian case".

;

;Three months after Zhang Jian was controlled, on April 12, 2019, Liu Shunping was controlled by the Xuanwei City Public Security Bureau on suspicion of committing extortion.

;

;Liu Shunping was born in Longtan Town, Xuanwei City in 1977. Xu Jinde, a veteran employee of his company, introduced that Liu Shunping joined the army after graduating from junior high school and returned to Longtan Town to work as a joint security guard after his discharge. While working in the joint defense team, Liu Shunping discovered business opportunities in coal transportation.

;

;Public information shows that the coal fields in Xuanwei are vast and rich in coal reserves, with proven and predicted reserves reaching 2.178 billion tons, making it the largest coal resource in Yunnan Province. One of the rich areas. Among them, the coal mine reserves in Longtan Town are about 100 million tons, and there are 12 developed large and small coal mines.

;

;In the late 1990s, Liu Shunping borrowed money from relatives and friends to start a coal transportation business and earned his first pot of gold.

;

;Liu Shunping's brother-in-law Jin Huaiying told Southern Weekend reporters that Liu Shunping bid for the Cide Coal Mine from the Longtan Town Government in 2004 and applied for a mining license. The mining license is valid for 10 years. Two or three years later, Liu Shunping bought Fangmaping Coal Mine.

;

;Jin Huaiying was the director of Cide Coal Mine. He introduced that as the operations of the two coal mines gradually got on track, Liu Shunping also accumulated a certain amount of wealth.

;

;While operating a coal mine in Longtan Town, Liu Shunping met Zhang Jian, the local evil leader in Xuanwei. The first-instance judgment of the "Zhang Jian case" shows that Zhang Jian was born on March 6, 1978 in Tianba Town, Xuanwei City. He was involved in society in his early years and became somewhat famous in the local area. Later, he gradually developed into one of the major evil forces in Xuanwei.

;

;"Many people in society don't understand how a private enterprise owner could associate with a gangster boss." Jin Huaiying explained that the social environment at that time was quite special, "He The two didn't know each other before. Zhang Jian celebrated his birthday twice a year, and every time he invited the boss of Xuanwei's business. Everyone went, how dare Liu Shunping not go?"

;

;Relevant evidence and materials show that the "1.5" task force established by the Qujing Municipal Public Security Bureau in response to the "Zhang Jian case" took control of Liu Shunping during the handling of the case, and took control of his brother Liu Shunfu on the same day.

;

;Indictment No. 310 of the Second Propaganda and Inspection Department (2020) shows that during the investigation process, the Qujing Municipal Public Security Bureau established another investigation against Liu Shunfu, Zhang Qiang, and Tao Yunrui. , Shan Qingze, Shan Qingman, Xu Wanquan, Guan Yuan, Li Jixiong and other eight evil forces criminal group "4·11" task force.

;

;The public security organs also captured Li Zhengyan while handling the "Zhang Jian case". Li Zhengyan is a key figure in connecting the "Zhang Jian case" and the "Liu Shunping brothers case". Among the criminal facts listed in the verdict of Zhang Jian's case, in 2011, Li Zhengyan conspired with Zhang Jian, Liu Shunping, and Liu Shunfu to extort a local coal mine owner, making illegal profits of more than 6.7 million yuan.

;

;Since October 2019, the Qujing Municipal Public Security Bureau has successively investigated the cases of Liu Shunfu and other eight people and Li Zhengyan on suspicion of extortion. Liu Shunping is suspected of organizing and leading a gangland organization. The criminal cases were transferred to the Qujing Municipal People's Procuratorate for review and prosecution.

;

;The above cases were assigned to the jurisdiction of the Shizong County People's Procuratorate under the jurisdiction of Qujing. In August 2020, due to the Qujing Intermediate People's Court's decision to change jurisdiction, the entire case was transferred to the Xuanwei City People's Procuratorate, and in September 2020, the case was prosecuted to the Xuanwei City People's Court for crimes such as gang involvement, provoking trouble, and extortion. .

;

;After the three cases of Liu Shunfu, Li Zhengyan and Liu Shunping were merged into one case, there were a total of 10 defendants in this case.

;

;According to the "Minutes of the Symposium on Trial of Criminal Cases of Triad Organizations in Some Courts across the Country" issued by the Supreme People's Court in 2015, underworld organizations should have a certain scale and number of people. There are usually more than 10 members in the organization. According to the "Opinions on Several Issues Concerning the Handling of Criminal Cases of Evil Forces" issued by the "Two High Schools and Two Ministries" in 2019, evil forces generally consist of more than three people, and the number of people who gather is relatively fixed.

;

; The first instance was "anti-criminal", and the second instance was remanded for retrial

;

;Xuanwei City Procuratorate alleged that since 2005, Liu Shunping had committed a crime against Zhang Jian Provide economic support and help, and gain shelter and connivance by roping in Yin Dabao, the former director of the Xuanwei City Public Security Bureau, Tian Fei, the former secretary of the Party Committee of Longtan Town in Xuanwei City, and gradually formed a situation with Liu Shunping as the organizer and leader, and Liu Shunfu as the organizer and leader. , Li Zhengyan as the key members, and a 10-person underworld organization with Tao Yunrui, Shan Qingze, Shan Qingman and others as active participants.

;

;Yin Dabao and Tian Fei both handled separate cases. Many of the 10 defendants charged by the prosecutor have criminal records. Tao Yunrui has a criminal record for drug abuse, Shan Qingze has a criminal record for robbery twice, and Shan Qingman has a criminal record for picking quarrels and provoking trouble.

;

;According to prosecutors' accusations, 2005 was a key time point for the formation of Liu Shunping's gang organization, but Xu Jinde and Jin Huaiying both said that Liu Shunping was not adapted to the special conditions of the local coal industry. Ecology, 2005 was a critical year for Liu Shunping’s “career change”.

;

;In 2005, Liu Shunping registered and established Huaping Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. in Xuanwei City. The company has developed real estate projects such as Jingang Yujing Mingdu and Jingang Yujing Wenhui in Xuanwei City.

;

;Xu Jinde introduced that with the successful development of real estate projects in Xuanwei urban area, Liu Shunping's main business actually shifted from coal mining to real estate. In 2013, Liu Shunping went to Qujing to engage in real estate investment business. During this period, he purchased real estate in Qujing City and brought his family to Qujing City to work and live. Later, he invested in real estate projects in Kunming, Pu'er and other places.

;

;On April 19, 2021, the gang-related case involving Liu Shunping and 10 people was heard in the Xuanwei City People's Court.

;

;The charges charged by the Xuanwei City People's Procuratorate are divided into two parts: organized crimes and individual crimes. Among them, there are 3 crimes involving organized crime, 7 crimes of picking quarrels and provoking trouble, 2 crimes of extortion, and 1 crime of illegal detention.

;

;Among the personal violations and criminal facts of the organization members, the personal crimes involve two crimes, 1 criminal fact of loan fraud, 1 criminal fact of bribery, and 3 personal illegal facts rise.

;

;According to the indictment, Liu Shunping did not participate in all the criminal facts. Among the organized crimes he was accused of, Liu Shunping participated in 5 crimes of picking quarrels and provoking trouble and 1 crime of extortion, and did not participate in the crime of illegal detention. Liu Shunping participated in all personal crimes.

;

;On December 10, 2021, the Xuanwei City People's Court issued a first-instance judgment.

;

;The court held that to identify a gang organization, it must have four statutory characteristics: organizational characteristics, economic characteristics, behavioral characteristics and harmful characteristics. However, in this case , although the behavioral characteristics charged by the public prosecution can be confirmed, the organizational characteristics and economic characteristics cannot be identified, and the harmful characteristics cannot be all identified. Therefore, the public prosecution’s accusation that Liu Shunping and 10 people constituted a crime of a gangland nature cannot be established.

;

;However, the Xuanwei City People's Court held that ten people including Liu Shunping should be identified as an evil criminal group, and Liu Shunping was the leader of the group.

;

;The court sentenced Liu Shunping to 20 years in prison and fined him 2.34 million yuan. Liu Shunfu, Li Zhengyan and others were also sentenced respectively.

;

;All 10 defendants in the case refused to accept the verdict and appealed to the Qujing Intermediate People's Court.

;

;On December 9, 2022, the Qujing Intermediate People's Court made a second-instance ruling, holding that some of the facts identified in the original judgment were unclear and sent it back to the Xuanwei City People's Court Rehearing.

;

;;

;

;2023 10 On March 9, the Xuanwei City People's Court reheard the case, and the trial has lasted for more than a month. (Southern Weekend reporter Zhai Xingli/Photo)

;

; Injury appraisal report issued after 6 years

;

;In the original trial, the public prosecution agency accused The facts of the crime of picking quarrels and provoking trouble are that on the evening of February 14, 2013, Xuanwei locals Lu Hongquan and He Liping quarreled in front of Liu Shunping's house over trivial matters, and then had an argument with Liu Shunping's driver. Liu Shunping then notified Zhang Jian, Li Zhengyan, and Liu Shunfu .

;

;Liu Shunfu went alone, while Zhang Jian and Li Zhengyan led more than 20 people to go there and beat Lu Hongquan and He Liping with weapons.

;

;On February 25, 2013, He Liping had a miscarriage. After the Liu Shunping case occurred in 2019, He Liping was diagnosed with minor injuries of the second degree. This is also the only crime in this case where the victim’s injuries were assessed.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters saw at the scene of the crime that Liu Shunping's home is a five-story building. There is a road outside the gate and a row of shops across the road. and residences.

;

;At that time, in addition to Liu Shunping and his wife on the second floor, there were also the driver on the first floor and Li Jishe, an employee of Liu Shunping's company. Li Jishe recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that the day of the incident was Valentine's Day in the West. During the time of the incident, he heard someone arguing outside on the first floor of Liu Shunping's house. When he looked outside, he saw an entertainment venue opposite Liu Shunping's house. , Lu Hongquan and He Liping were fighting with each other.

;

;From the quarrel between the two, Li Jishe heard that He Liping found Lu Hongquan celebrating the festival with other women in the entertainment venue. Li Jishe also said that Lu Hongquan knocked He Liping down and dragged him across the street to a car parked in front of Liu Shunping's house to leave. He Liping chased Lu Hongquan, and the two exchanged curses.

;

;"His car was parked in front of Liu Shunping's house. Liu Shunping's driver wanted to drive out. The road was blocked by Lu Hongquan's car, so I went over and asked Lu Hongquan to move. car." Li Jishe said that Lu Hongquan immediately pulled out a knife and chased him. He Liping took out a long knife from the car and several men accompanying Lu Hongquan also chased Liu Shunping's driver and Li Jishe with weapons.

;

;Li Jishe said that after Liu Shunping's gang-related case, the public security agency questioned him and produced a transcript. He gave a complete account of the above-mentioned incident. However, in the first-instance judgment, Li Jishe's witness testimony was only used to prove that Liu Shunping asked Zhang Jian to bring people to injure Lu Hongquan, and did not provide the complete story of the incident as claimed by him.

;

;Also puzzled is Liu Shunping's brother-in-law Xu Wanjing. Starting from February 2022, Xu Wanjing invited He Liping several times and recorded conversations with He Liping.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters asked two local outside lawyers to listen and translate part of the recording. In the recording, He Liping narrated the situation on the day of the incident, saying that she was not beaten by Liu Shunping's side, and recalled the process of questioning Liu Shunping by the public security organs after the gang-related case. However, according to her story, there seemed to be some inducement and accusations during the interrogation process. Southern Weekend reporters asked the Xuanwei City Public Security Bureau for confirmation, but they refused to be interviewed.

;

;In order for He Liping to issue a written explanation of the situation, Xu Wanjing paid her 30,000 yuan. In March 2022, during the second trial of Liu Shunping's gang-related case, Xu Wanjing and He Liping went to the post office together to mail a statement of the situation to the Qujing Intermediate People's Court.

;

;Unexpectedly, after receiving the document, the Intermediate People's Court of Qujing City believed that there was suspicion of perjury and handed it over to the People's Procuratorate of Qujing City as a criminal clue, and then the public security agency Launch an investigation.

;

;The People's Court of Zhanyi District, Qujing City made a first-instance judgment on July 29, 2023. Xu Wanjing was sentenced to two years in prison for obstructing testimony. After Xu Wanjing appealed, Qujing Intermediate People's Court made a second-instance ruling on September 26, 2023, rejecting the appeal and upholding the original judgment.

;

;Xu Wanjing's second-instance ruling shows that He Liping immediately changed her story after arriving at the case, saying that the mailed statement was a false statement. After the Liu Shunping gang-related case, the public security organs Her statements are true when questioned. The court accepted this.

;

;According to this ruling, on April 21, 2022, the Zhanyi Branch of the Qujing Municipal Public Security Bureau opened a case against He Liping on suspicion of perjury, but Zhanyi District The People's Procuratorate decided not to prosecute He Liping.

;

;When interviewed by Southern Weekend reporters, He Liping only admitted that she had a history of abducting women and children, but she said she "didn't know" about Liu Shunping's provocations and troubles and Xu Wanjing's obstruction of testimony. ".

;

;New charges

;

;On August 11, 2023, the Xuanwei City Procuratorate submitted a Prosecution and Sentence Change Appeal (2023) 6 to the court The number change and the supplementary prosecution decision still accuse Liu Shunping and others of being involved in crimes of a gangland nature.

;

;The Xuanwei City Procuratorate also changed Liu Shunping's personal illegal facts in the original indictment to an organized crime of gathering a crowd to attack state agencies.

;

;Comparing the changes, the supplementary prosecution decision and the original indictment show that the incident occurred before the Spring Festival in 2012, and Liu Shunping claimed that the Longtan Town Government of Xuanwei City had defaulted on his debts. On the grounds of receiving project funds, he instigated others to hire several villagers at a salary of 100 yuan per day to make noise and move around the Longtan Town government office area, eat free food in the government cafeteria, and lock official cars for more than ten days.

;

;In addition, in the original indictment, the two criminal facts of picking quarrels and provoking troubles, one criminal fact of extortion, and one illegal detention crime that Liu Shunping did not participate in were all disclosed. The change was made to Liu Shunping's "behind-the-scenes command and tacit approval."

;

;The decision also added the criminal facts of Liu Shunping's collusion in bidding and the criminal facts of illegal detention.

;

;It is worth noting that the fact of a new illegal detention crime is that in January 2015, Liu Shunping and Liu Shunfu arranged for others to detain Tao Zongzuo in order to collect illegal debts. , Yin Deping restricted his personal freedom for about 9 hours, and beat, insulted, and coerced Tao Zongzuo to force him to pay his debts.

;

;Xu Jinde said that Tao Zongzuo and Yin Deping made large loans to Liu Shunping and failed to repay them as agreed. Around 2016, Yin Deping borrowed 9 million yuan from Liu Shunping on the grounds of business turnover, but has not repaid the principal and interest so far. Around 2017, Yin Deping introduced Tao Zongzuo to borrow 22 million yuan from Liu Shunping. Tao Zongzuo has not yet repaid the principal and interest.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter asked Tao Zongzuo for confirmation that his mobile phone has been turned off. Judgment documents website shows that Tao Zongzuo and his company were sued many times for not fulfilling their repayment obligations and lost the lawsuit.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter contacted another creditor of Tao Zongzuo. The creditor said that Tao Zongzuo was a native of Xuanwei and had borrowed money from many local business owners on the pretext of operating a coal mine. For unknown reasons, Tao Zongzuo was unable to repay the loan and left the country to avoid other creditors after the Liu Shunping case was revealed.

;

;A material obtained by Southern Weekend reporters showed that after Zhang Ji was arrested by the public security agency on January 13, 2019, Tao Zongzuo reported to the relevant departments on February 16 of that year Send a report letter and report Liu Shunping as an evil force.

;

;On October 9, 2023, the retrial of Liu Shunping and others' gang involvement was heard in the Xuanwei City People's Court.

;

;Public information shows that in addition to the incident of lawyers' mobile phones being seized during the retrial, there were also many incidents that aroused widespread public attention, including the presiding judge's persuasion before the trial. The defendant pleaded guilty, and after the four defendants left the court, the court continued a 20-minute trial in absentia.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters asked the Xuanwei City People's Court for relevant information, but the other party refused because the case was under trial. As of press time, the trial has not ended.

;On December 5, 2023, the Intermediate People’s Court of Deyang City, Sichuan Province publicly announced the verdict of the former party group of the National Development and Reform Commission Zhang Wufeng, member and former Party Secretary and Director of the State Grain and Material Reserves Administration, was sentenced to ten years in prison for accepting bribes and fined RMB 1 million; Zhang Wufeng’s property and property obtained from the crime of accepting bribes and their properties were investigated The interest shall be recovered and turned over to the state treasury.

;

;;

;

;After trial, it was found that from 2003 to 2022, the defendant Zhang Wuli served as a member of the party group and deputy director of the former Shandong Provincial Administration for Industry and Commerce, and as deputy secretary of the Linyi Municipal Party Committee in Shandong Province , mayor, member of the Party Leadership Group of the People's Government of Shandong Province, deputy governor, member of the Party Leadership Group of the National Development and Reform Commission, Secretary of the Party Leadership Group, Director of the State Administration of Grain and Material Reserves, etc. The conveniences in their positions, as well as the convenient conditions for the formation of their powers or status, are for Relevant units and individuals provided assistance in matters such as project contracting and cadre selection and appointment, and illegally received property equivalent to more than 16.47 million yuan, of which 1.6 million yuan had not been actually obtained at the time of the incident.

;

;;

;

;;

;

;The Deyang Intermediate People's Court held that the defendant Zhang Wufeng, as a state worker, took advantage of his position to seek benefits for others. Taking advantage of the convenient conditions created by one's power or status to seek illegitimate benefits for others through the behavior of staff members of other countries, illegally accepting property from others, and the amount is particularly huge, such behavior constitutes the crime of accepting bribes. In view of the fact that Zhang Wufeng truthfully confessed all his crimes after arriving at the case, took the initiative to explain some of the bribery facts that the supervisory authority had not grasped, confessed his guilt and repented, and actively returned the stolen goods. All the property obtained from the bribery and its interest have been seized and brought to the case, some of the bribery attempts were unsuccessful, and he had made major meritorious services. It shows that there are statutory and discretionary lenient punishment circumstances, and he may be given a lighter punishment in accordance with the law. The court then made the above judgment.
